comments.body: Appveyor calls them [artifacts](https://www.appveyor.com/docs/packaging-artifacts/), so does [travis](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/uploading-artifacts/) and [circleci](https://circleci.com/docs/build-artifacts/). I get this wrong all the time too but since they use artifact vs artefact I guess we should for consistency too?

Though I agree that `artifacts` might be better. This was named to be consistent with [`conda-smithy`](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/blob/f97e45181b9e1f8131ad5d9f323322d1694cef78/conda_smithy/templates/run_docker_build.tmpl#L22) and thus existing feedstocks.

Still we could discuss changing it. We just would want @pelson on-board.
Thoughts on this @patricksnape. We can always go back and rename later. After all, this is only being used locally ATM.
Yeah i'm not dogmatic about - just might be a bit confusing! Probably better to just get it in to try it out for now?

Yeah, me neither. We should fix it here and in the feedstocks, but am ok doing that later.

Sure, let's get it out and play. Have had some other people use this successfully too. So it is already useful.
Addressing in the feedstocks and staged-recipes with PRs ( https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-smithy/pull/638 ) and ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/4753 ).
